thread.title: Day care center under investigation after baby abandoned
thread.title_full: Day care center under investigation after baby abandoned - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Day care center under investigation after baby abandoned
text:
A children's day care center in Chicago is under investigation after a baby was abandoned after it closed.
Journee Jones, 1, was discovered alone and crying in the dark at the ‘All Things Are Possible for Kids’ center in the city.
Her shocked dad Cornelius said he was panicked when he turned up to collect his baby daughter 15 minutes before the center closed and realized what had happened.
“I was terrified and I was also hurt because I knew she was in there in the dark and I couldn't get to her,” Jones told Fox 32 News .
“I was wondering where is she, where is she. I hear her, but I couldn't see her.”
Fox 32 News Cornelius Jones with his daughter Journee, who was accidentally locked inside the 'All Things Are Possible For Kids' day care center. Fox 32 News The 'All Things Are Possible For Kids' day care center in Chicago. Fox 32 News Quanesha Borum was shocked after her daughter was locked in the center. Previous Next Enlarge Jones called emergency services who rushed to the scene and helped the distraught dad force the door open.
The rescue was recorded in dramatic video which shows Journee on the floor of the center and crying in the dark.
Describing the moment he spotted his daughter, he said: “One of the police officers flashed a light to the left and flashed it back to the right and that's when I saw her crawling towards us screaming and my heart just dropped.”
Now, the Department of Children and Family Services are investigating the center.
Fox 32 News Firefighters pried open the door to rescue Journee. Fox 32 News Dramatic video captured the moment Journee was discovered in the center. Previous Next Enlarge Staff at the center told Jones that they were still in the back of the building by the time he arrived.
According to Journee’s mom Quanesha Borum, the director apologized and said staff had mistaken her daughter for a doll.
“She's not that little to be a doll, so it's some excuses,” said an unimpressed Borum.
Angry Jones has now called for the center to have its licence revoked and added: “If anything it should be shut down, I mean nobody leaves kids behind, toddlers.
“I don't care how old they are that’s dangerous.”
lhanna@nydailynews.com
